message: If you mess with global variables, the built in variable scope protection doesn't apply.
So if you stay with normal variables, then apps will not conflict, no matter how the kynetx apps are run.
I believe sandbox was implemented so that each app has its own sandbox and doesn't interfere with another app
DOM modifications can be a conflicting point, where two apps mess with the same DOM structure. There isn't a way to protect that.
For those interested in the technical details: We wrap our generated and emitted js code in carefully placed closures, creating variable scopes.
could interference in sandbox mode (variable name collision  for example) still occur? are there coding guidelines i need to follow so that doesn't happen?
variable name collision between kynetx apps is protected at the platform level, with a few conditions.
